name: TheAtlantic
text: In the past few days, scores of Americans brands have released statements decrying "injustice." Most of them purposefully skirt the actual problems, writes @amandamull. https://t.co/VxAKc55BNY

name: TheAtlantic
text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Just as his supporters mistake cruelty for honesty and bluster for courage, Trump has mistaken bloodlust for leadership. The bombast hides the fundamental truth that the president is a coward," @AdamSerwer writes: https://t.co/gX5MYDh1Ow

text: Growing up, @BriannaNHolt thought her parents were unreasonably strict with her and her brother. Now she see their rules as an appropriate reaction to the threats that face black people in the U.S. https://t.co/4TOOQdWtA6

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Mild" cases of COVID-19 are meant to be over within two weeks, but thousands of overlooked people are struggling with months of debilitating symptoms, @edyong209 reports. https://t.co/8hfkFGWXHV

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Had the NFL continued to support [Colin] Kaepernick all along, the league would be remembered in this moment as a true beacon of progress, rather than a bunch of shameless hypocrites,” @JemeleHill writes. https://t.co/0RLZlJa6Ok

name: TheAtlantic
text: "For some people who are sympathetic to the protesters’ cause, giving any fodder to those intent on criticizing them feels like a failure of solidarity," @conor64 writes. https://t.co/mkQb00zySk

name: TheAtlantic
text:
It “has been like nothing else on Earth,” said one man, who has previously endured dengue fever and malaria, and is on day 77 of COVID-19.

@edyong209 reports on the thousands of people struggling with months of debilitating symptoms from the coronavirus: https://t.co/zgpgynQ1Yk

text: Not only is it cruel to use tear gas during a pandemic that afflicts the lungs—it's ineffective, writes @zeynep: https://t.co/nlSHj492UO

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Donald Trump is the first president in my lifetime who does not try to unite the American people—does not even pretend to try,” General James Mattis writes in this extraordinary condemnation. https://t.co/o4jOWkJ5iy

text: "Deploying troops against the wishes of state and city leaders would only inflame passions, and could provoke a constitutional crisis," @conor64 writes: https://t.co/C4Mik1NzQx
